meanings.definition: Perform (an activity) or exercise (a skill) repeatedly in order to improve or maintain proficiency.
meanings.sent1: I practise playing the piano every day to get better.
meanings.sent2: She likes to practise her dance moves in the studio.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to practise climbing the tree, but it didn't go well.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to practise basketball made him a star player.
meanings.sent5: If you want to be a great chef, you must practise cooking regularly.

meanings.definition: The actual application or use of an idea, belief, or method, as opposed to theories about such application or use.
meanings.sent1: In science class, we put theory into practise by conducting experiments.
meanings.sent2: The success of the project depended on the team's ability to put their ideas into practise.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit showed a hilarious take on putting theory into practise.
meanings.sent4: Her innovative approach to putting theory into practise impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The workshop aimed to help participants understand how to apply theory into practise effectively.
